humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report indicates that the largest tumor size in the left breast is approximately 6.5 cm, as estimated from specimens 4 and 5. Based on the rules provided, T3 tumors are more than 5 cm. Therefore, the pathologic T stage for this patient's cancer is T3.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The T stage of breast cancer is determined by the size of the tumor and whether it has invaded the chest wall or skin. In this report, the tumor size is estimated to be 6.5 cm, which falls in the T3 category (tumor size >5 cm). This is stated in the 'Breast Cancer Prognostic Summary' section of the report: 'TUMOR SIZE: 6.5 CM (ESTIMATED FROM SPECIMENS 4 AND 5)'. Therefore, the T stage for this patient's cancer is T3.
